titleStmt.title: Woodford Ashley et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6766

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
July 3rd 1865 -- Mr Thomas Bramlete
Govenor of the State of Kentucky Dear Sir.

We the under signed petitioners of Ohio County knowing Valentine Ashley to be a correct man in his dealings and A. poor man and a weakly man and helpless family. And seeing the Certificate of Jacob H. Leach. We are fully satisfied that He is innocent of Intentionally violating the Law of the Land in any impropper conduct in the Sale of ardent serets and therefore Respectfully petition your Honor as governor of this state to remmit the fine in the case here is the facts in the case when Ashley was notified of the case he went before the Court and confessed all the facts in the case and the Judge put his fine at $20.00
